data.questionHtml:
Find the simple interest and the amount when:

Principal = Rs 6400, rate = 6% p.a. and time = 2 years

Find the simple interest and the amount when:

Principal = Rs 2650, rate = 8% p.a. and time = 212 years

Find the simple interest and the amount when:

Principal = Rs 1500, rate = 12% p.a. and time = 3 years 3 months.

Find the simple interest and the amount when:

Principal = Rs 9600, rate = 712% p.a. and time = 5 months.

Find the simple interest and the amount when:

Principal = Rs 5000, rate = 9% p.a. and time = 146 days.

Find the time when:

Principal = Rs 6400, SI = Rs 1152 and rate = 6% p.a.

Find the time when:

Principal = Rs 9540, SI = Rs 1908 and rate = 8% p.a.

Find the time when:

Principal = Rs 5000, amount = Rs 6450 and rate = 12% p.a.

Find the rate when:

Principal = Rs 8250, SI = Rs 1100 and time = 2 years.

Find the rate when:

Principal = Rs 5200, SI = Rs 975 and time = 212 years.

Find the rate when:

Principal = Rs 3560, amount = Rs 4521.20 and time = 3 years.
Shanta borrowed Rs 6000 from the State Bank of India for 3 years 8 months at 12% per annum. What amount will clear off her debt?
Hari borrowed Rs 12600 from a moneylender at 15% per annum simple interest. After 3 years, he paid Rs 7070 and gave a goat to clear off the debt. What is the cost of the goat?
The simple interest on a certain sum for 3 years at 10% per annum is Rs 829.50. Find the sum.
A sum when reckoned at <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>7</mn><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>%</mo></math> per annum amounts to Rs 3920 in 3 years. Find the sum
A sum of money put at 11% per annum amounts to Rs 4491 in 2 years 3 months. What will it amount to in 3 years at the same rate?
A sum of money invested at 8% per annum amounts to Rs 12122 in 2 years. What will it amount to in 2 years 8 months at 9% per annum?
At what rate per cent per annum will Rs 3600 amount to Rs 4734 in <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>3</mn><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> years?
If Rs 640 amounts to Rs 768 in 2 years 6 months, what will Rs 850 amount to in 3 years at the same rate per cent per annum?
In what time will Rs 5600 amount to Rs 6720 at 8% per annum?

A sum of money becomes <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfrac><mn>8</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac></math> of itself in 5 years at a certain rate of simple interest. Find the rate of interest.
A sum of money lent at simple interest amounts to Rs 783 in 2 years and to Rs 837 in 3 years. Find the sum and the rate per cent per annum.
A sum of money lent at simple interest amount to Rs 4745 in 3 years and to Rs 5475 in 5 years. Find the sum and the rate per cent per annum.
Divide Rs 3000 into two parts such that the simple interest on the first part for 4 years at 8% per annum is equal to the simple interest on the second part for 2 years at 9% per annum.
Divide Rs 3600 into two parts such that if one part be lent at 9% per annum and the other at 10% per annum, the total annum income is Rs 333.

Mark (✓) against the correct answer
The simple interest on Rs 6250 at 4% per annum for 6 months is

(a) Rs 125
(b) Rs 150
(c) Rs 175
(d) Rs 135

Mark (✓) against the correct answer
A sum amounts to Rs 3605 in 219 days at 5% per annum. The sum is

(a) Rs 3250
(b) Rs 3500
(c) Rs 3400
(d) Rs 3550

Mark (✓) against the correct answer
At simple interest a sum becomes 65 of itself in 212 years. The rate of interest per annum is

(a) 6%
(b) 712%
(c) 8%
(d) 9%

Mark (✓) against the correct answer
In what time will Rs 8000 amount to Rs 8360 at 6% per annum simple interest?

(a) 8 months
(b) 9 months
(c) 114 years
(d) 112 years

Mark (✓) against the correct answer
At what rate per cent annum simple interest will a sum double itself in 10 years?

(a) 8%
(b) 10%
(c) 12%
(d) 1212%

Mark (✓) against the correct answer
The simple interest at x% per annum for x years will be Rs x on a sum of

(a) Rs x
(b) Rs 100x
(c) Rs100x
(d) Rs100x2

Mark (✓) against the correct answer
The simple interest on a sum for 5 years is 25 of the sum. The rate per cent per annum is

(a) 10%
(b) 8%
(c) 6%
(d) 1212%

Mark (✓) against the correct answer
A borrows Rs 8000 at 12% per annum simple interest and B borrows Rs 9100 at 10% per annum simple interest. In how many years will their amounts be equal?

(a) 18 years
(b) 20 years
(c) 22 years
(d) 24 years
data.solutionHtml:
(c) 22 years

R1=12%R2=10%P1=Rs.8000P2=Rs.9100Let their amounts be equal in T years.Amount1=S.I.1+P1                =P1×R1×T100+P1                =8000×12×T100+8000                = 960T+8000Amount2=S.I.2+P2                =P2×R2×T100+P2                =9100×10×T100+9100                = 910T+9100Amount1=Amount2 ⇒960T+8000=910T+9100⇒960T-910T=9100-8000⇒50T=1100⇒T=22 Hence, after 22 years their amounts will be equal.

data.questionHtml:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
A sum of Rs 600 amounts of Rs 720 in 4 years. What will it amount to if the rate of interest is increased by 2%?

(a) Rs 724
(b) Rs 648
(c) Rs 768
(d) Rs 792
data.solutionHtml:
(c) Rs. 768

Let the rate be R %.S.I.= A-P     = 720-600     =Rs. 120Time=4 yearsR=100×SIP×T R=100×120600×4   =5Rate of interest=5%Now, R=(5+2)%=7%S.I.=P×R×T100  =600×7×4100  =Rs. 168Amount= SI+P              =600+168              = Rs. 768

data.questionHtml:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
x, y and z are three sums of money such that y is the simple interest on x and z is the simple interest on y for the same time and same rate. Which of the following is correct?

(a) xyz = 1
(b) z2 = xy
(c) x2 = yz
(d) y2 = zx

Mark (✓) against the correct answer
In how much time would the simple interest on a certain sum be 0.125 times the principal at 10% per annum?

(a) 114 years
(b) 134 years
(c) 214 years
(d) 234 years

Mark (✓) against the correct answer
At which sum will the simple interest at the rate of 334% per annum be Rs 210 in 213 years?

(a) Rs 1580
(b) Rs 2400
(c) Rs 2800
(d) none of these
Find the simple interest on Rs 6300 at 8% per annum for 8 months.
What sum will amount to Rs 6600 in 2 years at 10% per annum simple interest?
At what rate per cent per annum simple interest will Rs 3625 amount to Rs 4495 in 2 years?
In what time will Rs 3600 amount to Rs 4410 at 9% per annum simple interest?
At what rate per cent per annum simple interest will a sum double itself in 12 years?
data.solutionHtml: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><mo> </mo><mtext>Let the sum be Rs </mtext><mi>x</mi><mo>.</mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext>Amount </mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>Rs</mi><mo> </mo><mtext>2</mtext><mi>x</mi><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mo>∴</mo><mtext>S</mtext><mo>.</mo><mtext>I.</mtext><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>2</mtext><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>R</mi><mi>s</mi><mo> </mo><mi>x</mi></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext>Time</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext>2 years</mtext></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mo>∴</mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mtext>P</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi>S</mi><mo>.</mo><mi>I</mi><mo>.</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mo> </mo><mtext>T</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext>2 years</mtext></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mo>∴</mo><mo> </mo><mtext>R=</mtext><mfrac><mrow><mtext>100×S</mtext><mtext>.I.</mtext></mrow><mtext>P×T</mtext></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>100</mn><mo>×</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>×</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>8.3</mn><mi>%</mi></mtd></mtr></mtable><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace></math>

data.questionHtml: A sum of money becomes <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math> of itself in 6 years at a certain rate of simple interest. Find the rate of interest.

Mark (✓) against the correct answer

(a) 7%
(b) 8%
(c) 9%
(d) 12%

Mark (✓) against the correct answer
A sum amounts to Rs 3626 in 219 days at 6% per annum simple interest. The sum is

(a) Rs 3000
(b) Rs 3200
(c) Rs 3500
(d) Rs 3600

Mark (✓) against the correct answer
In what time will Rs 6000 amount to Rs 6360 at 8% per annum simple interest?

(a) 9 months
(b) 8 months
(c) 114  years
(d) 112 years

Mark (✓) against the correct answer
The simple interest on a sum for 5 yars is 35 of the sum. The rate per cent per annum is
(a) 8%
(b) 10%
(c) 12%
(d) 1212%

Mark (✓) against the correct answer
The simple interest at x% per annum for x years will be Rs x on a sum of

(a) Rs x
(b) Rs 10 x
(c) Rs 100 x
(d) Rs 100x

Mark (✓) against the correct answer
At what rate per cent per annum simple interest will a sum double itself in 10 years?

(a) 8%
(b) 10%
(c) 12%
(d) 1212%

Fill in the blanks.

(i) P=100×(......)R×T
(ii) R=100×SI(......)×T
(iii) At (......)% per annum simple interest a sum doubles itself in 10 years.
(iv) At simple interest a sum becomes 65 of itself in 212 years. The rate of interest is (......)% per annum.

data.questionHtml:
Write 'T' for true and 'F' for false

(i) Simple interest on Rs x for x years is Rs x. Then, the rate of interest is x% per annum.
(ii) Rate = 100×SIP×T.
(iii) A sum doubles itself at simple interest at 10% per annum in 10 years.
(iv) Simple interest on Rs 1000 at 5% per annum for 73 days is Rs 10.
data.solutionHtml: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>)</mo><mo> </mo><mi>False</mi><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mi>S</mi><mo>.</mo><mi>I</mi><mo>.</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo>×</mo><mi>R</mi><mo>×</mo><mi>T</mi></mrow><mn>100</mn></mfrac><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mo>⇒</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>×</mo><mi>R</mi><mo>×</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mn>100</mn></mfrac><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mo>⇒</mo><mi>R</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>100</mn><mo>×</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>×</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mo>⇒</mo><mi>R</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>100</mn><mi>x</mi></mfrac><mo>%</mo><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mo>(</mo><mi>iii</mi><mo>)</mo><mo> </mo><mi>True</mi><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mi>Let</mi><mo> </mo><mi>the</mi><mo> </mo><mi>sum</mi><mo> </mo><mi>be</mi><mo> </mo><mi>Rs</mi><mo> </mo><mi>x</mi><mo>.</mo><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mo>.</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mo>.</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mo>×</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi><mo>×</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></mrow><mn>100</mn></mfrac><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mo>.</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mo>.</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mo>.</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>Rs</mi><mo> </mo><mi>x</mi><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mi>Amount</mi><mo>=</mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mo>.</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mo>.</mo><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">x</mi><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mi>Rs</mi><mo> </mo><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">x</mi><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mspace
